     1	# Feature Specification: Receive Review Invitation
     2	
     3	**Feature Branch**: `001-review-invitation`  
     4	**Created**: February 02, 2026  
     5	**Status**: Draft  
     6	**Input**: User description: "UC-11.md UC-11-AT.md"
     7	
     8	## User Scenarios & Testing *(mandatory)*
     9	
    10	## Clarifications
    11	
    12	### Session 2026-02-02
    13	
    14	- Q: What should happen to a review invitation after the review due date passes? → A: Automatically becomes declined.
    15	- Q: What level of paper detail should be visible in the invitation list before acceptance? → A: Title only; abstract visible after accepting.
    16	- Q: What error message style should be shown when invitations cannot be retrieved? → A: Generic message with retry guidance (“Try again later or refresh”).
    17	- Q: What invitation statuses should be shown in the default invitations list view? → A: Show only pending by default; allow filtering for others.
    18	- Q: Is login required to view the invitations list? → A: Yes, login required.
    19	
    20	## Scope Clarifications
    21	
    22	- Accept/Reject processing logic is in scope for UC-11; selecting either updates the invitation status.
    23	- Invitation detail view and abstract visibility after acceptance are handled in a separate use case; UC-11 only covers the invitations list view.
    24	- Invitation list ordering (newest first) and pagination (beyond 20 items) are required in this feature.
    25	- Keyboard-only navigation support is required for the invitations list view.
    26	
    27	## Use Case Mapping *(mandatory)*
    28	
    29	- **Primary Use Case(s)**: UC-11
    30	- **Acceptance Tests**: UC-11-AT
    31	- **Notes**: Specifies behavior for receiving and viewing review invitations for assigned papers.
    32	
    33	## Constitution Check
    34	
    35	*GATE: Must pass before implementation.*
    36	
    37	- [x] Use-case traceability: feature maps to `UC-11.md`
    38	- [x] Acceptance tests: `UC-11-AT.md` identified for updates
    39	- [x] MVC separation: model/view/controller boundaries planned
    40	- [x] Vanilla stack: HTML/CSS/JS only; no frameworks or build-tool dependencies
    41	
    42	### User Story 1 - View Pending Review Invitation (Priority: P1)
    43	
    44	As a reviewer, I want to see my pending review invitations so I can decide whether to accept or reject each assignment.
    45	
    46	**Why this priority**: This is the core value of the feature; without it, reviewers cannot respond to review requests.
    47	
    48	**Independent Test**: Can be fully tested by assigning a reviewer to a paper and confirming the invitation appears with Accept/Reject options.
    49	
    50	**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    51	
    52	1. **Given** a reviewer is assigned to a paper, **When** the reviewer views their invitations list, **Then** the pending invitation appears with paper title and Accept/Reject options.
    53	2. **Given** a reviewer has multiple pending invitations, **When** they view the invitations list, **Then** each invitation is listed and correctly associated with its paper.
    54	
    55	---
    56	
    57	### User Story 2 - Receive Invitation Notification (Priority: P2)
    58	
    59	As a reviewer, I want to be notified when I receive a new review invitation so I don’t miss review requests.
    60	
    61	**Why this priority**: Notifications reduce missed assignments and improve response time.
    62	
    63	**Independent Test**: Can be tested by creating an invitation and verifying a notification is sent to the reviewer’s registered contact method.
    64	
    65	**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    66	
    67	1. **Given** a reviewer is assigned to a paper and notification service is available, **When** the invitation is created, **Then** the reviewer receives a notification of the invitation.
    68	
    69	---
    70	
    71	### User Story 3 - Secure and Resilient Access (Priority: P3)
    72	
    73	As a reviewer, I want my invitations to remain accessible even if notifications fail, and I expect only invited reviewers to see each invitation.
    74	
    75	**Why this priority**: Ensures reliability and protects confidentiality of submissions.
    76	
    77	**Independent Test**: Can be tested by simulating notification failure, delayed login, and unauthorized access attempts while verifying correct visibility and messaging.
    78	
    79	**Acceptance Scenarios**:
    80	
    81	1. **Given** a notification failure occurs, **When** the reviewer later views their invitations, **Then** the invitation is still visible and actionable.
    82	2. **Given** a reviewer who is not invited to a paper, **When** they attempt to access that invitation, **Then** access is denied or the invitation is not shown.
    83	3. **Given** an invitation retrieval error occurs, **When** the reviewer views invitations, **Then** a generic error message with retry guidance is shown.
    84	
    85	---
    86	
    87	### Edge Cases
    88	
    89	- Reviewer does not log in until days after the invitation is created.
    90	- Notification delivery fails but the invitation still exists.
    91	- Multiple invitations for different papers must be distinguishable.
    92	- A system error prevents invitations from loading.
    93	- A reviewer attempts to access an invitation they were not assigned.
    94	- Review due date passes before response.
    95	
    96	## Requirements *(mandatory)*
    97	
    98	### Functional Requirements
    99	
   100	- **FR-001**: System MUST create a review invitation when an editor assigns a reviewer to a paper.
   101	- **FR-002**: System MUST display pending review invitations to the invited reviewer with paper title and invitation status.
   102	- **FR-003**: System MUST provide Accept and Reject options for each pending invitation and persist the reviewer decision.
   103	- **FR-004**: System MUST attempt to send a review invitation notification to the reviewer when an invitation is created.
   104	- **FR-005**: System MUST keep the invitation available in the CMS even if notification delivery fails.
   105	- **FR-006**: System MUST restrict invitation visibility to the invited reviewer.
   106	- **FR-007**: System MUST automatically mark an invitation as declined when the review due date passes without a response.
   107	- **FR-008**: System MUST show a generic, user-friendly error message with retry guidance when invitations cannot be retrieved.
   108	- **FR-009**: System MUST allow reviewers with multiple invitations to view each invitation as a distinct item linked to the correct paper.
   109	- **FR-010**: System MUST limit invitation list details to paper title prior to acceptance.
   110	- **FR-011**: System MUST show only pending invitations by default and allow filtering to view non-pending invitations.
   111	- **FR-012**: System MUST require the reviewer to be logged in to view invitations.
   112	- **FR-013**: System MUST order invitations newest first and support pagination beyond 20 items.
   113	- **FR-014**: System MUST include paper title and response due date in invitation notifications.
   114	
   115	### Assumptions
   116	
   117	- The reviewer’s registered contact method is used for invitation notifications.
   118	
   119	### Key Entities *(include if feature involves data)*
   120	
   121	- **Review Invitation**: Represents a request to review a paper; includes status (pending/accepted/rejected/declined/expired), created date, and response deadline.
   122	- **Reviewer**: Registered user who can view and respond to invitations; includes contact information.
   123	- **Paper**: The submission being reviewed; includes identifier, title, and abstract.
   124	- **Notification**: The outbound message informing a reviewer about a new invitation and its delivery status.
   125	
   126	### Non-Functional Requirements
   127	
   128	- **NFR-001**: Invitation list loads within 2 seconds under normal load.
   129	- **NFR-002**: Invitations are visible to the invited reviewer within 1 minute of assignment.
   130	- **NFR-003**: Invitations list is keyboard accessible (tab order, focus states, and actionable controls usable without a mouse).
   131	
   132	## Success Criteria *(mandatory)*
   133	
   134	### Measurable Outcomes
   135	
   136	- **SC-001**: 95% of reviewers can locate a pending invitation within 2 minutes of logging in during usability testing.
   137	- **SC-002**: 99% of invitations are visible to the invited reviewer within 1 minute of assignment in controlled tests.
   138	- **SC-003**: 98% of invitation notifications are delivered successfully when the notification service is available.
   139	- **SC-004**: 100% of access attempts by non-invited reviewers are blocked in authorization tests.
   140	- **SC-005**: 100% of invitation retrieval failures display a generic message with retry guidance in testing.

    68	### Implementation for User Story 1
    69	
    70	- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Update OpenAPI contract in specs/001-review-invitation/contracts/review-invitations.openapi.yaml to add accept/reject action endpoint
    71	- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Create ReviewInvitation model in src/models/review_invitation.js
    72	- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Create Paper model in src/models/paper.js
    73	- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement review invitation list service in src/services/review_invitation_service.js (default pending, newest-first sort, pagination, status refresh)
    74	- [ ] T016 [US1] Implement invitations list controller in src/controllers/review_invitations_controller.js (auth guard, fetch, empty-state handling)
    75	- [ ] T017 [US1] Implement accept/reject action service in src/services/review_invitation_action_service.js (update status)
    76	- [ ] T018 [US1] Add accept/reject handlers in src/controllers/review_invitations_controller.js (invoke action service)
    77	- [ ] T019 [US1] Build invitations list view in src/views/review-invitations.html (title-only display, status, Accept/Reject buttons, filters, pagination controls)
    78	- [ ] T020 [US1] Add list rendering and interaction logic in src/views/scripts/review-invitations.js (fetch, render, filter, pagination, retry, accept/reject actions, auto-refresh for 1-minute visibility)
    79	- [ ] T021 [US1] Add page-specific styles and focus states in src/views/styles/review-invitations.css
    80	- [ ] T022 [US1] Wire invitations route and view entry in src/controllers/router.js and src/views/index.html
    81	
    82	**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 should be fully functional and testable independently
    83	
    84	---
    85	
    86	## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Receive Invitation Notification (Priority: P2)
    87	
    88	**Goal**: Send a notification when an invitation is created, with clear content.
    89	
    90	**Independent Test**: Create an invitation and verify a notification record is created and delivered (or failed) with the correct content.
    91	
    92	### Acceptance Tests for User Story 2 (REQUIRED) ⚠️
    93	
    94	- [ ] T023 [P] [US2] Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for notification delivery and required content
    95	
    96	### Implementation for User Story 2
    97	
    98	- [ ] T024 [P] [US2] Create Notification model in src/models/notification.js
    99	- [ ] T025 [US2] Implement notification service in src/services/notification_service.js (send + record delivery status)
   100	- [ ] T026 [US2] Add invitation creation hook to trigger notification in src/services/invitation_creation_service.js (non-blocking)
   101	- [ ] T027 [US2] Create notification template content in src/views/templates/review-invitation-notification.txt
   102	- [ ] T028 [US2] Include paper title and response due date in notification payload in src/services/notification_service.js
   103	
   104	**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 should be fully functional and testable independently
   105	
   106	---
   107	
   108	## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Secure and Resilient Access (Priority: P3)
   109	
   110	**Goal**: Ensure only invited reviewers can view invitations and errors are safe and retryable.
   111	
   112	**Independent Test**: Attempt access as a different reviewer, simulate notification failure, and simulate invitation retrieval errors to confirm correct behavior.
   113	
   114	### Acceptance Tests for User Story 3 (REQUIRED) ⚠️
   115	
   116	- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for authorization, notification failure resilience, and generic retry messaging
   117	
   118	### Implementation for User Story 3
   119	
   120	- [ ] T030 [US3] Enforce reviewer authorization in src/services/authorization_service.js (invited reviewer only)
   121	- [ ] T031 [US3] Handle 401/403/500 responses with generic retry messaging in src/controllers/review_invitations_controller.js and src/views/components/error-banner.html
   122	- [ ] T032 [US3] Ensure invitation retrieval proceeds when notification fails in src/services/invitation_creation_service.js (do not block on failure)
   123	- [ ] T033 [US3] Add audit logging for unauthorized access attempts in src/services/security_log_service.js
   124	
   125	**Checkpoint**: All user stories should now be independently functional
   126	
   127	---
   128	
   129	## Phase 6: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   130	
   131	**Purpose**: Improvements that affect multiple user stories
   132	
   133	- [ ] T034 [P] Add loading/empty state copy in src/views/review-invitations.html and styles in src/views/review-invitations.css
   134	- [ ] T035 [P] Add performance timing log and warning in src/views/scripts/review-invitations.js for 2-second load target
   135	- [ ] T036 [P] Validate and update quickstart steps in specs/001-review-invitation/quickstart.md for performance, 1-minute visibility, and keyboard checks
   136	
   137	---
   138	
   139	## Dependencies & Execution Order
   140	
   141	### Phase Dependencies
   142	
   143	- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   144	- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
   145	- **User Stories (Phase 3+)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
   146	- **Polish (Final Phase)**: Depends on all desired user stories being complete
   147	
   148	### User Story Dependencies
   149	
   150	- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on other stories
   151	- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - Independent of US1 but uses shared foundation
   152	- **User Story 3 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - Independent of US1/US2 but uses shared foundation
   153	
   154	### Within Each User Story
   155	
   156	- Acceptance tests in `UC-11-AT.md` before implementation
   157	- Models before services
   158	- Services before controllers/views
   159	- Core implementation before integration
   160	
   161	### Parallel Opportunities
   162	
   163	- Phase 1 tasks marked [P]
   164	- Phase 2 tasks marked [P]
   165	- Acceptance test updates per user story
   166	- Model creation within a user story
   167	- Different user stories can run in parallel after Phase 2
   168	
   169	---
   170	
   171	## Parallel Example: User Story 1
   172	
   173	```bash
   174	# Update acceptance tests for User Story 1 first:
   175	Task: "Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for list fields, ordering, pagination, default pending filter, and action buttons"
   176	
   177	# Launch models for User Story 1 together:
   178	Task: "Create ReviewInvitation model in src/models/review_invitation.js"
   179	Task: "Create Paper model in src/models/paper.js"
   180	```
   181	
   182	---
   183	
   184	## Parallel Example: User Story 2
   185	
   186	```bash
   187	# Update acceptance tests for User Story 2 first:
   188	Task: "Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for notification delivery and content"
   189	
   190	# Run model and template work together:
   191	Task: "Create Notification model in src/models/notification.js"
   192	Task: "Create notification template content in src/views/templates/review-invitation-notification.txt"
   193	```
   194	
   195	---
   196	
   197	## Parallel Example: User Story 3
   198	
   199	```bash
   200	# Update acceptance tests for User Story 3 first:
   201	Task: "Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for authorization, notification failure resilience, and generic retry messaging"
   202	
   203	# Parallelize auth + logging:
   204	Task: "Enforce reviewer authorization in src/services/authorization_service.js"
   205	Task: "Add audit logging for unauthorized access attempts in src/services/security_log_service.js"
   206	```
   207	
   208	---
   209	
   210	## Implementation Strategy
   211	
   212	### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)
   213	
   214	1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   215	2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
   216	3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1
   217	4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test User Story 1 independently
   218	5. Deploy/demo if ready
   219	
   220	### Incremental Delivery
   221	
   222	1. Complete Setup + Foundational → Foundation ready
   223	2. Add User Story 1 → Test independently → Deploy/Demo (MVP!)
   224	3. Add User Story 2 → Test independently → Deploy/Demo
   225	4. Add User Story 3 → Test independently → Deploy/Demo
   226	5. Each story adds value without breaking previous stories
   227	
   228	### Parallel Team Strategy
   229	
   230	With multiple developers:
   231	
   232	1. Team completes Setup + Foundational together
   233	2. Once Foundational is done:
   234	   - Developer A: User Story 1
   235	   - Developer B: User Story 2
   236	   - Developer C: User Story 3
   237	3. Stories complete and integrate independently
   238	
   239	---
   240	
   241	## Notes
   242	
   243	- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
   244	- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   245	- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
   246	- Verify acceptance criteria are defined before implementing
   247	- Avoid vague tasks and cross-story dependencies

Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: /root/493-lab/Lab2/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
### How to use skills
- Discovery: The list above is the skills available in this session (name + description + file path). Skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description shown above, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deep reference-chasing: prefer opening only files directly linked from `SKILL.md` unless you're blocked.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

payload.message:
## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and basic structure

- [ ] T001 Create MVC folders and base module stubs in src/models/index.js, src/services/index.js, src/controllers/router.js
- [ ] T002 Review UC-11.md for alignment with scope, ordering, pagination, and keyboard accessibility requirements (no edits yet)
- [ ] T003 Create base layout and shared styles in src/views/layout.html and src/views/styles/base.css
- [ ] T004 [P] Add shared DOM helpers in src/views/scripts/dom.js

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**⚠️ CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

- [ ] T005 Implement authentication gate in src/controllers/auth_controller.js and wire into src/controllers/router.js
- [ ] T006 [P] Implement API client wrapper in src/services/api_client.js for GET /api/review-invitations and POST/PATCH for accept/reject actions
- [ ] T007 [P] Implement pagination helpers in src/services/pagination.js
- [ ] T008 Implement invitation creation on editor assignment in src/services/invitation_creation_service.js and src/controllers/editor_assignments_controller.js
- [ ] T009 Implement invitation status updater (auto-decline on response_due_at) in src/services/invitation_status_service.js
- [ ] T010 [P] Implement generic error banner component in src/views/components/error-banner.html and styles in src/views/styles/base.css

---

### Acceptance Tests for User Story 1 (REQUIRED) ⚠️

- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Update acceptance tests in UC-11-AT.md for list fields, ordering, pagination, default pending filter, keyboard access, and accept/reject state changes
- [ ] T037 [P] [US1] Update UC-11.md to reflect acceptance test changes and final UC-11 scope

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Update OpenAPI contract in specs/001-review-invitation/contracts/review-invitations.openapi.yaml to add accept/reject action endpoint
- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Create ReviewInvitation model in src/models/review_invitation.js
- [ ] T014 [P] [US1] Create Paper model in src/models/paper.js
- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement review invitation list service in src/services/review_invitation_service.js (default pending, newest-first sort, pagination, status refresh; depends on T009)
- [ ] T016 [US1] Implement invitations list controller in src/controllers/review_invitations_controller.js (auth guard, fetch, empty-state handling; depends on T005)
